title: A chair was sold at a loss of 10%. If it was sold at Rs. 84 more, there would have been a gain of 4% . For how much was the chair sold? - Quora

response.answer_text: Solution of the given problem is shown below, Let C & S denote respectively the original cost-price & the original sell-price of the given chair.It is mentioned that the chair was sold at a loss of 10%. So we get the following relation,S = (1 - 0.10)*C = 0.90*C or C = (10/9)*S …… (1)It is mentioned that if the chair was sold at Rs. 84 more, there would have been a gain of 4%. So we get the following relation,S + 84 = (1 + 0.04)*C = 1.04*C = (26/25)*Cor S + 84 = (26/25)*(10/9)*S [from (1)]or S + 84 = (52/45)*S or 45*S + 45*84 = 52*Sor 7*S = 45*84 or S = 45*12 = 540 (Rs) [Ans]
Let C.P be =x Then S. P=90/100x Given that it was sold at 84 more,then 90/100x+84=104/100x (bcz given that at a gain of 4%) X=600(C.P) They asked S.P of the chair 600*90/100=540(S.P)
